message.content:
{"id": "3622", 
"title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message", 
"description": "When using the New Package Wizard, a confusing message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even if the package name field is empty. This message needs clarification.", 
"OB": "", 
"EB": "When opening the New Java Package Wizard, if the package name field is empty, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear. Additionally, the message should provide more context or guidance on how to create a default package.", 
"SR": "1. Remove the warning message when the package name field is empty\n2. Add more explanatory context or guidance on how to create a default package"}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'SR': ''}
